item.title: How Not to Be a Leader
item.description: In this blog post we’ll explore some of the practices you should NOT follow if you pretend to improve your leadership Based on personal experience in a leadeship program DON’T stablish vague, unclear targets You, as a leader, need to be a source of trust. It’s your task to make people following you have a feel of clear understanding what are the goals and how those goals are achieved. Not being clear about what to do or sending contradictory messages are perfect example of what you shouldn’t do
